title: hand scripted "Namen für Rossoschka"
content:
hello fellas,  
I normally dislike to post font id-request from other forums  
but in this case i’d like to know the answer. so please id this one.

thx, nike

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=font_5.jpg) | 135.93 KB |
author: nike

comments.content: My guess is this is a persons handwriting that has been converted to type. There is a company that will do it for something like $6 or $9. Someone will chime in with details.
that was my first thougt too, but the connections of the glyps are to perfect to be a 9$ conversion.

Nike,

Your reasons are understandable, and you may be right that it is a professional script design, but for what it’s worth, it isn’t one that I have collected, and Script fonts are my specialty.

I am inclined to think that this is a personal font, but made by someone who took the trouble to do it right. I don’t think it is a commercially available script font.

If we find out otherwise, I want to add it to the Script Font ID Guide.

- Mike Yanega
